author: wsjcom
title: EU Is Right to Seek More Taxes From U.S. Platforms
text:
The European Commission is heading down the right path in the case of “Europe’s Tax War on U.S. Tech” (Review & Outlook, March 22). The U.S. should follow its lead and adopt a uniform, destination-of-sales system when taxing corporate profit. The current approach—taxing profit based on “origin”—is nearly meaningless since origin can be shifted virtually anywhere through arbitrary transfer pricing. The result is companies like Google generating millions of dollars in sales and profit in Europe but paying little tax there.
